43996684||Issey Miyake L'Eau d'Issey Eau de Toilette for Women (3.3 Fl. Oz.) Inspired by the fresh scents of waterfalls and springtime forests, this aquatic floral perfume blends notes such as lotus, lily, and cedar Issey Miyake doesn’t believe in fashion. He doesn’t believe in “gorgeous clothes.” Instead, he says, what he believes in is “a human being and a piece of cloth.” His first pieces were rooted in his native Japan, including revivals of traditional quilted pieces, such as the  , made from scraps, and the  . He began his work with the goal of breathing life back into Japan, which he saw “culturally obliterated” after the atomic bomb was dropped on his hometown of Hiroshima. He focused his designs on bright color, unique texture, and above all, functionality. After studying in Paris and New York, he began to experiment with pleating, working to twist and stitch in new and innovative ways. His goal was to find a pleat style that wouldn’t restrict movement and that would be easy to care for, and that gave birth to the Pleats Please line of apparel. In 1983, he told  , “I want to find out what clothing might be.” He has experimented with clothing the customers themselves cut at their preferred length, dresses that resemble paper lanterns, and two pairs of pants sewn together so you and your imaginary friend can be literally joined at the hip. Although his brand has appeared in   and Paris fashion shows every year since 1973, Miyake has always meant to appeal to a wider audience, emphasizing versatility and claiming the motto, “Clothes for everyone, not just a few.” Aquatic floral fragrance Inspired by the clear, refreshing scents of waterfalls, flowers, and springtime forests Transparent top notes of lotus, freesia, and cyclamen along with juicy melon Heart notes of peony, lily, and carnation Woody base notes of cedar, sandal, musk, and amber Created by perfumer Jacques Cavallier Launched in 1992 3.3 fl. oz. spray bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

The hallmarks of Kate Spade may be identical to those of the modern woman: wit, curiosity, and playful sophistication. When the brand launched in 1993, founder Kate Brosnahan Spade wielded the expertise she’d gained as fashion-accessories editor of  . The result was a line of nylon bags that married chic utilitarian silhouettes with vibrant color patterns. Besides drawing the eye of women everywhere, these now-signature bags attracted her own kind; fashion editors everywhere cooed over her vibrant colors, practical shapes, and graphic patterns. Today, the brand remains true to its original design philosophy and has grown to offer clothing, jewelry, stationery, and home goods. 46562341||Burberry Mini Fragrances for Women Collection of some of Burberry’s most popular perfumes includes the aromatic Brit Rhythm and floral scents London, Body Tender, and Weekend At his Hampshire shop in the 1850s, Thomas Burberry outfitted hunters and fishermen in rugged gear. Rain was a real misery for the outdoorsmen, so Burberry set out to create an alternative to an umbrella or the shade of an elephant. By 1888, he’d secured the patent for his design: a breathable cotton blend wound so tightly it could resist moisture and rips. Officially, it was called gabardine, but in common parlance, hunters, farmers, pub keepers, and even King Edward VII called it “Burberry.” At the onset of World War I, the inventor used the fabric for a waterproof trench coat literally for the trenches, fitted with the necessary epaulets and D-rings for an artillery-facing soldier. The trench’s style caught on and, decorated with Burberry’s signature tartan print, remains a staple of the brand today. Despite these ties to tradition, Burberry’s creative team lives by the motto  , Latin for “forward.” Classic time-tested shapes are updated with modern details such as statement buttons, metallic fabrics, and seasonal colors. 48009117||Elizabeth Arden Sunflowers Fragrance Set for Women (3-Piece) Popular fragrance by Elizabeth Arden is as bright, cheerful, and appealing as its floral namesake Strength and independence were part of Elizabeth Arden’s life long before she started her own cosmetics company. Born Florence Nightingale Graham, the Canadian-born Arden’s drive and ambition to follow her own path mirrored that of her namesake. While working as a bookkeeper for a pharmaceuticals company in New York City, Arden became fascinated by the science of skincare and cosmetics. In 1910, she opened a spa on Fifth Avenue that focused on holistic ideas such as hydration and yoga to help women care for their skin and bodies. Arden’s dedication to science and innovation helped her company become the trusted global beauty brand that it is today with award-winning and fan favorite products, such as Prevage anti-aging daily serum or Eight Hour cream skin protectant. 48225313||Eau de Lacoste L.12.12 Bleu Eau de Toilette for Men; 1.7 Fl. Oz. A blend of citrus, mint, and woodsy aromas creates a fresh and distinctly masculine fragrance that’s ideal for everyday wear L. 12.12 Bleu conjures up relaxing boat rides in the summer with a blend of water fruit aromas that give way to a backbone of woodsy notes for a masculine touch. Long before he invented the polo or coined the now-instantly-recognizable logo that brands them, Grand Slam tennis champion René Lacoste was given a curious nickname by the press. Never one to bow to traditional on-court attire, “The Alligator” proudly displayed his new persona through a small, embroidered version of the predatory animal on his tennis blazers. As an extension of this rebellion, he invented the polo shirt, believing there was a market for more casual short-sleeved shirts, instead of the dress shirts typically worn on court. Each would—and would continue to—bear the alligator insignia for which the tennis master was known. The company has continually produced its signature polo since 1933, but since then, Lacoste has evolved into a full line of athletic-inspired sportswear for men and women. Top: grapefruit, peppermint Heart: sage, orange blossom Base: patchouli, oak moss, fern Design house: Lacoste Launched in 2011 1.7 fl. oz. spray bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance

46317550||Viktor & Rolf Spicebomb Eau de Toilette for Men (1.7 Fl. Oz.) Woody, spicy fragrance features a masculine blend of leather, tobacco, grapefruit, and pink pepper Ultrahip designers Viktor Horsting and Rolf Snoeren believe “fashion is an antidote to reality, it has the power of transformation and provides a window to a different, magical world.” This belief in fantasy has been apparent since the Dutch wunderkinds’ first Parisian show in 1993, where they upset couture ideals with a series of edgy, reconstructed ball gowns. The inventive designers gather inspiration from seemingly disparate sources—Golden Age portraiture, De Stijl functionalism, and experimental designers Elsa Schiaparelli and Yohji Yamamoto, among others—and weave them into complex architectural pieces that teeter between ready-to-wear and the avant-garde.  In recent years, the duo has moved away from the highly fantastical world of couture into a more mainstream presence. They developed a popular fragrance with L’Oréal and debuted a well-received collection at H&M. Horsting expanded on this when he said, “A fashion show is for an elite and this elite … will look for the new dress … of the season, which is what fashion’s about. But we would like fashion to be about more than that.” Men’s warm spicy fragrance Fiery accord of chili, saffron, leather, tobacco, and vetiver Explosive accord of bergamot, grapefruit, elemi, and pink pepper Launched in 2013 1.7 fl. oz. spray ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance

48009116||Jean-Paul Gaultier Le Male Summer Limited Edition Cologne Tonique Spray for Men (4.2oz.) Limited-edition Le Male cologne invokes a masculine sea-side arouma with notes of mint, grass, and soft vanilla A Google search for Jean-Paul Gaultier will bring up thousands of websites, many with the words “enfant terrible” in the page preview. The French designer,   says, “is one of those designers whose vivid public persona…is an invaluable part of the brand. So what is shorthand for  ? Breton stripe, peroxided hair, brilliant tailoring—and a cheeky, cheerful irreverence.” Since launching his label in the ‘70s, he’s scuttled gender stereotypes and embraced a degree of sexualized fashion. For Madonna’s Blonde Ambition tour, he designed a cone-shaped brassiere that became nearly as iconic as the singer herself, recently auctioning for $52,000. He designed a skirt for men and paired a hyper-feminine crinoline skirt with a leather jacket for women. His perfumes come in bottles sculpted to resemble the kinds of torsos in magazines behind the gas-station counter.  “I don’t think I was ever concerned with shocking people…I just wanted to show what I found fair or normal or beautiful,” Gaultier said. Though the fearlessness of his work grabs headlines, it’s his meticulous craftsmanship and beautifully transgressive designs that have earned him a reputation as an artist. His pieces have even been on display at the Met and San Francisco’s De Young museum. 47848699||Kenneth Cole Black Eau de Toilette for Men (3.4 Fl. Oz.) Invigorating fragrance for men by Kenneth Cole features a blend of ginger, mandarin orange, basil, and cedar On his first day in business, Kenneth Cole parked a 40-foot trailer, director, camera, and troop of actresses in Midtown Manhattan, just across the street from the Hilton. Somebody had painted “Kenneth Cole Productions, Inc.” on the side of the trailer. Nobody had loaded film into the camera. The movie was a ruse—a way for the young designer to get a coveted parking permit and set up his mobile shoe store in the heart of New York. It worked. In less than three days, he sold 40,000 pairs of shoes. More than two decades later, Kenneth Cole has expanded his line beyond high-quality high-fashion shoes to include trendy apparel, handbags, and watches for men and women around the world. He’s known for updating classic looks with modern details, such as adding a wedge heel to a pair of pointed-toe boots or making sure that a watch can tell the current time on Jupiter. 48300401||Vera Wang Anniversary Eau de Parfum for Women (3.4 fl. oz.) Eau de parfum for women with notes of mandarin orange, apple leaf, gardenia, amber, and cedar; released in 2010 Vera Wang never set out to be a designer. The New York native trained as a competitive figure skater for much of her youth, and after failing to make the 1968 Olympic team, transferred her energies to the study of fashion. That effort paid off, as Wang became one of the youngest-ever fashion editors at  , and later began designing for houses such as Ralph Lauren. While planning her wedding, she was faced with a gaping hole in the couture landscape: fashion-forward bridalwear. Never one to step away from a challenge, Wang opened her bridal shop one year later. Her salon quickly set the standard for custom and couture bridal, attracting celebrities such as Jennifer Lopez, Uma Thurman, Chelsea Clinton, and that tiny woman who lives on top of the wedding cake. Over 20 years after her launch, Wang’s brand has expanded to include ready-to-wear clothes as well as an entire lifestyle line covering everything from fine papers to fragrances. Through it all, Wang has remained committed to finely crafted designs made to withstand the tests of time and trend. The designer says a woman “is never sexier than when she is comfortable in her clothes.” Top notes: mandarin orange, Sicilian bergamot, apple leaf, and water Middle notes: orange blossom, gardenia, and rose Base notes: amber, musk, orris root, and cedar  Inner wrists Decolletage Other pulse points 3.4 fl. oz. After Marty crash lands in the 1950s in the 1985 flick  , girls call him “Calvin,” thanks to his purple Calvin Klein briefs with their signature, designer-stamped waistband. One adoring girl breathes, “I’ve never seen purple underwear before.” Just three years before the movie, Calvin Klein underwear had premiered to a great uproar. Devotees stole ads from bus stations and demanded that stars like Marky Mark “drop trou” onstage to show off their Calvins. The designer gained notoriety for hypersuggestive commercials for everything from blue jeans to perfume, launching the careers of models like Brooke Shields and Kate Moss in the process. But what has kept his brand relevant for over 40 years is its classic, impeccably tailored clothing.   writes, “Klein always understood that the modern shopper wanted easy, versatile, and interchangeable separates to wear anywhere.” He made clothes for strong, confident American women—women who didn’t have time to put together elaborate outfits every morning. “I’m not doing costumes,” he said. “I believe in classic clothes—not the faddishness that looks right this season and is dead the next.” Floral, sensual scent for women Recommended for romantic wear Notes of black violet, pomegranate, and lotus blossom  Design house: Calvin Klein Introduced in 2005 1.7 fl. oz. pendulum-shaped bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

47591655||Halston Z-14 Cologne Spray for Men; 1 or 8 Fl. Oz. Citrus, spice, cedar, and deep musk combine to create a sharp and masculine scent suitable for casual or everyday wear Roy Halston Frowick (1932-1990) didn’t take long to get his fashion designs into the national consciousness. At President John F. Kennedy’s inauguration in 1961, Jacqueline Kennedy wore a hat designed by Halston, and soon he had a client list that included Liza Minnelli, Marlene Dietrich, Elizabeth Taylor, and Anjelica Huston. His innovations included the durable, washable ultra-suede, as well as the halter dress, a sleek, elongated number that fits comfortably into discotheques, such as his beloved Studio 54. Today, Halston’s legacy lives on in his eponymous company, which offers a wide line of ready-to-wear apparel, dresses, handbags, and accessories. 47617494||Burberry Brit Eau de Toilette or Eau de Parfum for Women (1.7 Fl. Oz. or 3.3 Fl. Oz.) Fragrances for women by Burberry cloak the wearer in fresh, gourmand blends of fragrances including green lemon, pear, and vanilla At his Hampshire shop in the 1850s, Thomas Burberry outfitted hunters and fishermen in rugged gear. Rain was a real misery for the outdoorsmen, so Burberry set out to create an alternative to an umbrella or the shade of an elephant. By 1888, he’d secured the patent for his design: a breathable cotton blend wound so tightly it could resist moisture and rips. Officially, it was called gabardine, but in common parlance, hunters, farmers, pub keepers, and even King Edward VII called it “Burberry.” At the onset of World War I, the inventor used the fabric for a waterproof trench coat literally for the trenches, fitted with the necessary epaulets and D-rings for an artillery-facing soldier. The trench’s style caught on and, decorated with Burberry’s signature tartan print, remains a staple of the brand today. Despite these ties to tradition, Burberry’s creative team lives by the motto  , Latin for “forward.” Classic time-tested shapes are updated with modern details such as statement buttons, metallic fabrics, and seasonal colors. Top notes of green lemon, frosted pear, and white almond Heart note of white peony Base notes of vanilla, amber, mahogany, and balsamic tonka bean accords Introduced in 2003 Winner of the 2004 FiFi Awards Fragrance of the Year, Women’s Prestige 1.7 fl. oz. or 3.3 fl. oz. Sean John, his menswear label, has had its ups and downs, but it too has emerged to become a major player in the fashion world. Founded in the late 1990s, the label offers a wide line of apparel for men and boys, as well as hats, loungewear, and eyewear. 48307907||Salvatore Ferragamo Incanto Shine Eau de Toilette for Women (1.7 or 3.4 Fl. Oz.) Fruity, floral fragrance from Salvatore Ferragamo with notes including passion fruit, pink peony, and amber At the peak of Hollywood’s golden age, Salvatore Ferragamo designed shoes for the brightest starlets. For Judy Garland, he crafted a cork-wedge heel. For Audrey Hepburn, he created suede ballet flats that eventually became part of the fashion icon’s signature look. Marilyn Monroe “owned dozens of pairs … and not one without a stiletto heel.”  The stars were drawn to the shoes not only for their impeccable style but also for their innovative construction and design. The Ferragamo-invented platform heel, for instance, added comfort as well as height. The designer built traditional heels with a steel arch, shifting the weight from the ball of the foot to the instep and allowing stilettos to grow ever taller. In total, Ferragamo filed 350 patents and executed roughly 20,000 designs. His legacy lives on in his brand’s luxurious shoes and wares, as well as a museum filled with Hollywood memorabilia and enough shoes to outfit a human-sized millipede. Top notes: pineapple, bergamot, and passion fruit Heart notes: pink peony, freesia, and peach Base notes: cedar, amber, and musk Fruity, floral fragrance Colorful, summer-themed bottle Launched in 2007 1.7 or 3.4 fl. oz. ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

Fresh men’s fragrance opens with soft strains of lavender and bergamot that give way to a heart heavy with the rugged scent of oakmoss With the majestic Alpine peak Mont Blanc as its guide, Montblanc has striven to be the pinnacle of luxury and style for more than 100 years. It all started in 1906 with an ingenious new writing tool, a “simple” pen with a built-in ink well. The fountain pen quickly gained a reputation as the best on the market, not just for its craftsmanship and dependability, but as a status symbol of style and culture. After decades of innovative marketing campaigns and global recognition, Montblanc has expanded its repertoire into leather goods, watches, jewelry, and cologne, cementing its status as purveyor of the world’s finest little luxuries. 47673120||Lacoste Eau de Lacoste Blanc Eau de Toilette for Men (3.3 fl. oz.) Spicy men’s fragrance with notes of rosemary, cardamom, cedar, and suede Long before he invented the polo or coined the now-instantly-recognizable logo that brands them, Grand Slam tennis champion René Lacoste was given a curious nickname by the press. Never one to bow to traditional on-court attire, “The Alligator” proudly displayed his new persona through a small, embroidered version of the predatory animal on his tennis blazers. As an extension of this rebellion, he invented the polo shirt, believing there was a market for more casual short-sleeved shirts, instead of the dress shirts typically worn on court. Each would—and would continue to—bear the alligator insignia for which the tennis master was known. The company has continually produced its signature polo since 1933, but since then, Lacoste has evolved into a full line of athletic-inspired sportswear for men and women. 48173797||Vera Wang Flower Princess Eau de Toilette for Women (1.7 Fl. Oz.) Vera Wang is best-known for her romantic bridal designs, and this light and floral fragrance fits right into her ethereal aesthetic  Vera Wang never set out to be a designer. The New York native trained as a competitive figure skater for much of her youth, and after failing to make the 1968 Olympic team, transferred her energies to the study of fashion. That effort paid off, as Wang became one of the youngest-ever fashion editors at  , and later began designing for houses such as Ralph Lauren. While planning her wedding, she was faced with a gaping hole in the couture landscape: fashion-forward bridalwear. Never one to step away from a challenge, Wang opened her bridal shop one year later. Her salon quickly set the standard for custom and couture bridal, attracting celebrities such as Jennifer Lopez, Uma Thurman, Chelsea Clinton, and that tiny woman who lives on top of the wedding cake. Over 20 years after her launch, Wang’s brand has expanded to include ready-to-wear clothes as well as an entire lifestyle line covering everything from fine papers to fragrances. Through it all, Wang has remained committed to finely crafted designs made to withstand the tests of time and trend. 48252929||Burberry London for Women or Men (Assorted Sizes) Burberry fragrances for women and men distinguish themselves with bold, sophisticated notes and come sheathed in Burberry’s signature plaid  At his Hampshire shop in the 1850s, Thomas Burberry outfitted hunters and fishermen in rugged gear. Rain was a real misery for the outdoorsmen, so Burberry set out to create an alternative to an umbrella or the shade of an elephant. By 1888, he’d secured the patent for his design: a breathable cotton blend wound so tightly it could resist moisture and rips. Officially, it was called gabardine, but in common parlance, hunters, farmers, pub keepers, and even King Edward VII called it “Burberry.” At the onset of World War I, the inventor used the fabric for a waterproof trench coat literally for the trenches, fitted with the necessary epaulets and D-rings for an artillery-facing soldier. The trench’s style caught on and, decorated with Burberry’s signature tartan print, remains a staple of the brand today. Despite these ties to tradition, Burberry’s creative team lives by the motto  , Latin for “forward.” Classic time-tested shapes are updated with modern details such as statement buttons, metallic fabrics, and seasonal colors. 48253702||Dior Addict Eau Fraiche for Women; 3.4 Fl. Oz. Light, summery fragrance for women imparts a daytime blend of notes such as bergamot, grapefruit, lotus, and pomegranate Recommended for daytime wear in the spring and summer When Christian Dior was 14 years old, a palm reader at the local fair told him his fortune. She said that after a period of great poverty, he would travel widely and make his fortune from women. Both came true. Despite financial trials following the Great Depression and a serious bout of tuberculosis, Dior rose to become one of the world’s most influential fashion designers. After working under Pierre Balmain, he revolutionized women’s dress in 1947 with his post–World War II “New Look”—a curvaceous silhouette marked by a tiny, defined waist and voluminous midcalf skirt. Dior, an avid gardener, described it by saying, “I drew women-flowers, fine waists like liana and wide skirts like corolla.” The frenzy that followed its introduction helped cement Dior in the annuls of fashion history. Today, the company carries on the powerful name of Christian Dior, leading the industry in womens- and menswear beneath such innovators as Raf Simons and Bill Gaytten. 46524584||Gucci Mini Set for Women (4-Piece) This mini-set allows you to sample four different Gucci fragrances, allowing you to find your signature scent In the late 1800s, Guccio Gucci worked as a bellhop for The Savoy hotel in London. Carrying heavy luggage stuffed with fine clothing and early-edition paper e-readers, he noticed that Tuscan luggage was a favorite of the wealthy families who visited the hotel. He returned to Florence and opened his own leather goods workshop and store in 1921. Business boomed. Artisans designed a diamond-printed bag and the interlocking G logo—both icons of this brand to this day. By the 1960s and ’70s, the brand’s customers included Audrey Hepburn, Grace Kelly, Jackie O, and Queen Elizabeth II. In 1979, the New York Times wrote that Gucci’s G insignia was “a status symbol recognized around the world.”  Today, Gucci continues to produce signature items such as a bamboo-handled handbag, a Jackie O handbag, and penny loafers. Their modern menswear combines classic European styles with impeccable tailoring. Women’s apparel borrows menswear looks, such as suits and blazers, and updates them with plush fabrics or edgy silhouettes. Inspired by the black rose, this eau de parfum mixes notes of rose and vanilla with notes such as papyrus and patchouli In 1935, Armand Petitjean found inspiration in the yellow flowers that dotted the grounds of the Château de Lancosme, a castle just outside of Paris. The chemist was so inspired by the beauty that he named his company for the place and made those flowers its emblem. Stars such as Isabella Rossellini, Kate Winslet, and Penélope Cruz have all appeared beside the Lancôme rose, epitomizing the natural femininity and immunity to pollen touted by the respected cosmetic brand. “True luxury is efficacy,” Youcef Nabi has told  . As the current head of Lancôme, Nabi is well aware that, to remain relevant in this industry, a brand must deliver tangible results. Though Lancôme’s cosmetic products—such as Définicils mascara and Juicy Tubes lip gloss—remain industry-wide favorites, its science-based skincare line has earned a cult following of its own. This focus on effectiveness remains at the forefront of the nearly 80-year-old company’s consciousness. 45930197||Dolce by Dolce & Gabbana Eau de Parfum for Women (1.6 or 2.5 Fl. Oz.) Inspired by the beauty of Sicily, this fragrance smells like a gentle breeze flowing through a garden of white flowers The names Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana are synonymous with high fashion, though that was not always the case. In the 1980s, the young designers corralled anyone they could into loft spaces and even fast-food restaurants (with burger-shaped invitations no less) they’d transformed into makeshift show rooms. From the beginning, “the boys” played with juxtaposition, contrasting masculine versus feminine, virgin versus harlot in the same designs. In ‘85, the pair made their Milan Fashion Week debut as part of a young talent showcase and never looked back. The international brand has made a name for itself by subverting fashion tropes. Corset dresses and leopard prints are transformed into sophisticated and wearable pieces. Perhaps most famously, the pair redefined women’s suiting with menswear-inspired shapes and tailoring. In addition to clothes, fragrances and other accessories perpetuate the brand’s baroque charm. Madonna, who recognized the pair early on and wore their designs for her 1993 Girlie Show tour commented “Their clothes are sexy with a sense of humor—like me.” Soft, feminine scent teeming with white flowers Inspired by the beauty of Sicily Top notes of neroli leaf and papaya flower Heart notes of white amaryllis, narcissus, and white water lily Base notes of cashmere and musk Launched in 2014 1.6 or 2.5 fl. oz. spray bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

48299588||Guess Eau de Toilettes for Men. Multiple Options Available. Assortment of fragrances by Guess cloak the wearer in masculine blends of notes In 1981, brothers Paul and Maurice Marciano left the south of France for California after a strange pursuit. Not sand or surf, but that distinctly American wardrobe staple: denim. Their timing was impeccable. In 1979, Vogue had written, “Watch out—designer jeans are taking over … a disco in Texas posted a sign saying if you wear jeans to the disco, you have to wear ‘designer’ jeans.” In 1980, Diana Vreeland proclaimed, “Blue jeans are the most beautiful things since the gondola.” A frenzy for status jeans had swept the country. Luckily, the Marciano brothers had a knack for denim. Their first pair was a stonewashed jean so skin-tight it had zippers at the ankles to help women slip inside. Bloomingdale’s stocked just two dozen pairs and sold out in hours. From a seemingly simple beginning, the design house blossomed into an international company that fashions apparel, accessories, and even body products for men and women. Despite over 30 years of business, they remain true to the original aesthetic of their three-zip jeans: youthful, sexy, and all-American. 47882743||Viktor & Rolf BonBon Eau de Parfum for Women; 1.7 Fl. Oz. Inspired by the rich and indulgent candy, BonBon has caramel in the forefront and features fruit, flower, and woods scents Ultrahip designers Viktor Horsting and Rolf Snoeren believe “fashion is an antidote to reality, it has the power of transformation and provides a window to a different, magical world.” This belief in fantasy has been apparent since the Dutch wunderkinds’ first Parisian show in 1993, where they upset couture ideals with a series of edgy, reconstructed ball gowns. The inventive designers gather inspiration from seemingly disparate sources—Golden Age portraiture, De Stijl functionalism, and experimental designers Elsa Schiaparelli and Yohji Yamamoto, among others—and weave them into complex architectural pieces that teeter between ready-to-wear and the avant-garde.  In recent years, the duo has moved away from the highly fantastical world of couture into a more mainstream presence. They developed a popular fragrance with L’Oréal and debuted a well-received collection at H&M. Horsting expanded on this when he said, “A fashion show is for an elite and this elite … will look for the new dress … of the season, which is what fashion’s about. But we would like fashion to be about more than that.” Top notes of caramel, mandarin, orange, and peach Orange blossom and jasmine in the heart Base notes of cedar, guaiac wood, sandalwood, and amber Introduced in 2014 Bow-shaped bottle Bottle size: 1.7 fl. oz. ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

Refreshing men’s fragrance blends floral notes of peony and jasmine with earthier notes of sandalwood and eucalyptus After Marty crash lands in the 1950s in the 1985 flick  , girls call him “Calvin,” thanks to his purple Calvin Klein briefs with their signature, designer-stamped waistband. One adoring girl breathes, “I’ve never seen purple underwear before.” Just three years before the movie, Calvin Klein underwear had premiered to a great uproar. Devotees stole ads from bus stations and demanded that stars like Marky Mark “drop trou” onstage to show off their Calvins. The designer gained notoriety for hypersuggestive commercials for everything from blue jeans to perfume, launching the careers of models like Brooke Shields and Kate Moss in the process. But what has kept his brand relevant for over 40 years is its classic, impeccably tailored clothing.   writes, “Klein always understood that the modern shopper wanted easy, versatile, and interchangeable separates to wear anywhere.” He made clothes for strong, confident American women—women who didn’t have time to put together elaborate outfits every morning. “I’m not doing costumes,” he said. “I believe in classic clothes—not the faddishness that looks right this season and is dead the next.” Refreshing men’s fragrance Top notes: peony, jasmine, and lily of the valley Middle notes: eucalyptus, pear blossom, orchid, and syringa Base notes: sandalwood and tonka bean Application: eau de toilette Capacity: 1.7 or 3.4 fl. oz. ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance

Floral flanker to DKNY’s popular Be Delicious fragrance, this perfume distinguishes itself with notes of violet, acacia flower, and rose “Think of it as the younger, floral based, hip, sister to your favorite scent.” —  Designer Donna Karan’s DKNY label has New York City right in its name, and the brand has been inspired by city’s electric, fast, and modern spirit since its launch in 1985. Frustrated with the lack of options for the modern working woman, Karan launched a collection of separates that could mix-and-match around a basic black bodysuit. Though it sounds simple,   wrote that the debut collection, “forever changed the way professional women outfit themselves.” Tellingly, DKNY clothes regularly appeared in the landmark 1980s show,  , which portrayed a female TV journalist. Though Karan excelled at designing for strong women, in 1991, she introduced a menswear line, and in 1993, she became the first woman to win a CFDA Menswear Designer of the Year award. 47938950||Christian Dior Homme Sport Eau de Toilette for Men (3.4 Fl. Oz.) Bright citruses mingle with spicy ginger in this cologne from Christian Dior, creator of popular men’s fragrances Ambre Nuit and Sauvage When Christian Dior was 14 years old, a palm reader at the local fair told him his fortune. She said that after a period of great poverty, he would travel widely and make his fortune from women. Both came true. Despite financial trials following the Great Depression and a serious bout of tuberculosis, Dior rose to become one of the world’s most influential fashion designers. After working under Pierre Balmain, he revolutionized women’s dress in 1947 with his post–World War II “New Look”—a curvaceous silhouette marked by a tiny, defined waist and voluminous midcalf skirt. Dior, an avid gardener, described it by saying, “I drew women-flowers, fine waists like liana and wide skirts like corolla.” The frenzy that followed its introduction helped cement Dior in the annuls of fashion history. Today, the company carries on the powerful name of Christian Dior, leading the industry in womens- and menswear beneath such innovators as Raf Simons and Bill Gaytten. Citrusy, spicy cologne Instantly presents aromas of grapefruit, bergamot, elemi resin, and Sicilian lemon Evolves into a heart of Atlas cedar, vetiver, and ginger Settles on notes of sandalwood, rosemary, and lavender Launched in 2008 3.4 fl. oz. spray bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance

47739342||Best of Elizabeth Arden Fragrances for Women Collection of iconic Elizabeth Arden fragrances include Red Door, which was inducted into the Fragrance Hall of Fame in 2013 Strength and independence were part of Elizabeth Arden’s life long before she started her own cosmetics company. Born Florence Nightingale Graham, the Canadian-born Arden’s drive and ambition to follow her own path mirrored that of her namesake. While working as a bookkeeper for a pharmaceuticals company in New York City, Arden became fascinated by the science of skincare and cosmetics. In 1910, she opened a spa on Fifth Avenue that focused on holistic ideas such as hydration and yoga to help women care for their skin and bodies. Arden’s dedication to science and innovation helped her company become the trusted global beauty brand that it is today with award-winning and fan favorite products, such as Prevage anti-aging daily serum or Eight Hour cream skin protectant. 45768218||Burberry Weekend Fragrance for Women or Men; 3.3 fl. oz. Casual fragrances for men and women share notes of woods, fruits, and musk At his Hampshire shop in the 1850s, Thomas Burberry outfitted hunters and fishermen in rugged gear. Rain was a real misery for the outdoorsmen, so Burberry set out to create an alternative to an umbrella or the shade of an elephant. By 1888, he’d secured the patent for his design: a breathable cotton blend wound so tightly it could resist moisture and rips. Officially, it was called gabardine, but in common parlance, hunters, farmers, pub keepers, and even King Edward VII called it “Burberry.” At the onset of World War I, the inventor used the fabric for a waterproof trench coat literally for the trenches, fitted with the necessary epaulets and D-rings for an artillery-facing soldier. The trench’s style caught on and, decorated with Burberry’s signature tartan print, remains a staple of the brand today. Despite these ties to tradition, Burberry’s creative team lives by the motto  , Latin for “forward.” Classic time-tested shapes are updated with modern details such as statement buttons, metallic fabrics, and seasonal colors. Burberry Weekend eau de parfum for women Burberry Weekend eau de toilette for men 3.3 fl. oz. Eau de parfum Fragrance notes: soft peach, apricot, marigold, sandalwood, vanilla, musk Released in 1997 3.3 fl. oz. Eau de toilette Fragrance notes: cedarwood, tangerine, musk, iris, rose Released in 1997  ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

47768767||Dolce & Gabbana The One Lace Edition and The One Desire Eau de Parfum for Women (1.6 fl. oz.) New twists on Dolce & Gabbana’s popular The One fragrance, updated with punches of citrus or poured into special-edition bottles The names Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana are synonymous with high fashion, though that was not always the case. In the 1980s, the young designers corralled anyone they could into loft spaces and even fast-food restaurants (with burger-shaped invitations no less) they’d transformed into makeshift show rooms. From the beginning, “the boys” played with juxtaposition, contrasting masculine versus feminine, virgin versus harlot in the same designs. In ‘85, the pair made their Milan Fashion Week debut as part of a young talent showcase and never looked back. The international brand has made a name for itself by subverting fashion tropes. Corset dresses and leopard prints are transformed into sophisticated and wearable pieces. Perhaps most famously, the pair redefined women’s suiting with menswear-inspired shapes and tailoring. In addition to clothes, fragrances and other accessories perpetuate the brand’s baroque charm. Madonna, who recognized the pair early on and wore their designs for her 1993 Girlie Show tour commented “Their clothes are sexy with a sense of humor—like me.” Dolce & Gabbana The One Lace eau de parfum (1.6 fl. oz.) Dolce & Gabbana The One Desire eau de parfum (1.6 fl. oz.) 48122076||Guy Laroche Drakkar Noir Eau de Toilette for Men A member of the Fragrance Hall of Fame, this classic men’s scent blends together notes such as lavender, cinnamon, and cedar When Guy Laroche began designing women’s clothes in 1957, the prevailing trend was the “New Look;” think the nipped-in waists and full skirts of midcentury Hollywood costumes. Laroche’s elegant, understated designs liberated women from the constrictive tailoring normally found in those couture garments. Among his other landmark fashions, it was Laroche who created the shirt-dress now so ubiquitous in modern styleAmong his other landmark fashions, it was Laroche who created the shirt-dress now so ubiquitous in modern style. After ushering in a new era of women’s fashion, he launched a duo of fragrances and luxury timepieces for men and women. Laroche’s cumulative contributions to international fashion earned him a Légion d’Honneur from the French government in 1987, two years before his death. 47938964||Jessica Simpson I Fancy You Eau de Parfum for Women (3.4 Fl. Oz.) This perfume blends a fruity opening, floral heart, and sensual, musky base for a truly feminine and agreeable scent Famously famous for her lack of knowledge about buffalo or tuna, there are lots of things Jessica Simpson does know. The multitalented Texan knows music, movies, and a lot about fashion. She started small, designing a line of edible beauty products, and worked her way up to a full-blown clothing, shoes, accessories, and home decor empire. Her designs are known for their approachable, girl-next-door appeal. The label tends toward casual styles that are trendy, but wearable and more affordable than most celebrity labels. “She has a keen insight into what her customers want: exceptional value,” says powerhouse shoe designer and collaborator Vince Camuto. “She [is involved in everything] from selecting materials to determining the prints and styles that work best for a woman’s body.” Not one to shy away from statement items herself, Simpson also mixes in glamorous pieces like oversized sunglasses and animal-print accessories. 45760105||Best of Gucci Fragrances for Women Choose from three feminine perfumes: the sweet Gucci by Gucci, the white-floral Gucci Première, and the spicy-floral Gucci Guilty In the late 1800s, Guccio Gucci worked as a bellhop for The Savoy hotel in London. Carrying heavy luggage stuffed with fine clothing and early-edition paper e-readers, he noticed that Tuscan luggage was a favorite of the wealthy families who visited the hotel. He returned to Florence and opened his own leather goods workshop and store in 1921. Business boomed. Artisans designed a diamond-printed bag and the interlocking G logo—both icons of this brand to this day. By the 1960s and ’70s, the brand’s customers included Audrey Hepburn, Grace Kelly, Jackie O, and Queen Elizabeth II. In 1979, the New York Times wrote that Gucci’s G insignia was “a status symbol recognized around the world.” Today, Gucci continues to produce signature items such as a bamboo-handled handbag, a Jackie O handbag, and penny loafers. Their modern menswear combines classic European styles with impeccable tailoring. Women’s apparel borrows menswear looks, such as suits and blazers, and updates them with plush fabrics or edgy silhouettes. Style.com described the brand’s “sexy, show-offy” aesthetic as “rock chic deluxe.” Fragrance notes: mandarin, pink pepper, lilac, geranium, peach, and patchouli 1.6 fl. oz. eau de toilette spray Introduced in 2010 Fragrance notes: orange blossom, bergamot, leather, wood, musk, and white flowers 1.6 fl. oz. eau de parfum spray Introduced in 2012 Fragrance notes: chamomile, tiare flower, guava, raspberry, pear, spider lily, patchouli, honey, musk, and orange blossom 1.7 fl. oz. eau de toilette spray Introduced in 2007 ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

48215426||Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette for Women (1.7 Fl. Oz.) Popular fragrance by Vera Wang features a light, youthful blend of fruity and floral notes ideal for daytime wear Vera Wang never set out to be a designer. The New York native trained as a competitive figure skater for much of her youth, and after failing to make the 1968 Olympic team, transferred her energies to the study of fashion. That effort paid off, as Wang became one of the youngest-ever fashion editors at  , and later began designing for houses such as Ralph Lauren. While planning her wedding, she was faced with a gaping hole in the couture landscape: fashion-forward bridalwear. Never one to step away from a challenge, Wang opened her bridal shop one year later. Her salon quickly set the standard for custom and couture bridal, attracting celebrities such as Jennifer Lopez, Uma Thurman, Chelsea Clinton, and that tiny woman who lives on top of the wedding cake. Over 20 years after her launch, Wang’s brand has expanded to include ready-to-wear clothes as well as an entire lifestyle line covering everything from fine papers to fragrances. Through it all, Wang has remained committed to finely crafted designs made to withstand the tests of time and trend. The designer says a woman “is never sexier than when she is comfortable in her clothes.” Youthful, feminine fragrance by Vera Wang Top notes of water lily, apple, mandarin, and apricot Heart notes of guava, Tiare flower, tuberose, and dark chocolate Base notes of vanilla, amber, and wood Launched in 2006 1.7 fl. oz.  ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

Notes of goji berries, pomegranate, and musk mix together to make this delicate eau de toilette Spelled with a   but pronounced as a  , the Bvlgari brand began as a small silver shop in Rome in 1884. Founder Sotirio Bulgari came from an ancient family of Greek silversmiths; today, third generation family members carry on the family tradition of transforming raw precious elements into sparkling statement necklaces. Each piece begins with a sketch, as designers assess the color, brilliance, wearability, and je ne sais quoi. In an interview with the  , Nicola Bulgari said, “Each piece has its own philosophy.” Though he draws inspiration from architecture around the world—from India to Columbus, Indiana—he says, “I don’t like the idea of a global style … the same things all over the world. 48126164||Issey Miyake L'Eau d'Issey Pour Homme Eau de Toilette for Men (2.5 Fl. Oz. or 4.2 Fl. Oz.) Summery scent mists men with a woody-aquatic blend of notes including yuzu, nutmeg, tobacco, and lemon Recommended for daytime wear in the spring and summer Issey Miyake doesn’t believe in fashion. He doesn’t believe in “gorgeous clothes.” Instead, he says, what he believes in is “a human being and a piece of cloth.” His first pieces were rooted in his native Japan, including revivals of traditional quilted pieces, such as the  , made from scraps, and the  . He began his work with the goal of breathing life back into Japan, which he saw “culturally obliterated” after the atomic bomb was dropped on his hometown of Hiroshima. He focused his designs on bright color, unique texture, and above all, functionality. After studying in Paris and New York, he began to experiment with pleating, working to twist and stitch in new and innovative ways. His goal was to find a pleat style that wouldn’t restrict movement and that would be easy to care for, and that gave birth to the Pleats Please line of apparel. In 1983, he told  , “I want to find out what clothing might be.” He has experimented with clothing the customers themselves cut at their preferred length, dresses that resemble paper lanterns, and two pairs of pants sewn together so you and your imaginary friend can be literally joined at the hip. Although his brand has appeared in   and Paris fashion shows every year since 1973, Miyake has always meant to appeal to a wider audience, emphasizing versatility and claiming the motto, “Clothes for everyone, not just a few.” Top notes of yuzu, bergamot, lemon, and tarragon Middle notes of nutmeg and water lily Base notes of tobacco, sandalwood, cedar, vetiver, and musk Eau de toilette for men Launched in 1994 2.5 fl. oz. or 4.2 fl. oz. ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance
48347789||Liz Claiborne Curve for Men Set (5-Piece) Try this spicy-citrus aroma in multiple bath products or give it as a gift for birthdays, holidays, or stocking stuffers When Liz Claiborne started her eponymous label in 1976, she’d had about enough of the fashion industry. She was tired of the male-dominated hierarchy and the unflattering professional clothing they designed for women. It was a pivotal moment: after the domestically centered ’50s and mandatory tie-dye camps of the ’60s, women were entering the workforce in mass. So, she did something about it. “She created a new foundation for a modern working woman’s wardrobe,”   wrote. She designed wearable, flattering pieces that were easy to mix and match. She insisted that department stores put all her clothing together so women could quickly and easily grab separates and go. Sometimes, she would pose as a salesgirl in dressing rooms to teach women how to wear clothes. “The concept was to dress the American working woman because I, as a working woman with a child, didn’t want to spend hours shopping,” she told  . “Things should be easy.” She must have struck a chord: Liz Claiborne was the first company founded by a woman to reach the Fortune 500. 4.2oz. and 0.5oz. cologne 2.6oz. deodorant 4.2oz. skin soother 6.7oz. hair & body wash Top notes: pineapple, juniper berries, lavender, neroli, lemon Heart notes: coriander, ginger, violet, cactus, sage, bergamot, cardamom Base notes: sandalwood, amber, musk, vetiver, cedar, mahogany, pepper Launched in 1996 Comes in gift box ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Men's Fragrance

46595770||BCBG Max Azria Bon Chic Eau de Parfum for Women (3.4 Fl. Oz.) Bon Chic reflects high style in both name and reality, offering a sensual scent with a fruity opening, floral heart, and soft, warm body “Bon chic” means “good style” in French, and it’s also a reference to the first two letters of the BCBG brand itself. “Bon chic, bon genre,” Parisian slang for “good style, good attitude” is what BCBG stands for, both literally and figuratively. Max Azria founded the brand in 1989, though it truly came into it’s own when Azria’s wife Lubov joined the team in 1991. What began as a brand for modern women quickly branched out into many distinct apparel lines. BCBGeneration epitomizes the casual, bohemian-chic aesthetic, while the upscale Max Azria Collection injects power and femininity into professional and casual chic clothing. In addition to apparel and shoes, the brand has a full accessory line running the gambit from sunglasses to watches to handbags. The husband-and-wife’s collaborations grace the windows of more than 550 BCBGMAXAZRIA boutiques dotting the planet that has all the oceans and people on it. This floral perfume can bring to mind fields of peonies and green lilacs, offering a pleasant experience to anyone who catches a whiff of it Today, Lanvin is the oldest French fashion house in operation, “best loved among editors and celebs for exquisitely made womenswear,” according to  . The   called Lanvin “one of fashion’s hottest labels” when reporting on a pair of metallic-capped Lanvin sneakers spotted on Michelle Obama. But though the house enjoys a storied fashion history and reputation for luxury today, it rose from humble beginnings. Born on New Year’s Day, 1867, Jeanne Lanvin was the oldest of 11 children. She started work young, delivering hats for a milliner, and eventually became a milliner herself. But it wasn’t until her daughter Marguerite was born that her love for fashion truly flourished. She made clothes for Marguerite’s doll, then for Marguerite herself—and millinery customers took note of the the girl’s gorgeous frocks. They started ordering clothing, and from there, a fashion house was born. By the 1920s, the house of Lanvin had seven branches in France and worldwide, and Jeanne was an influential member of the fashion world. Today, Lanvin is under the creative direction of designer Alber Elbaz, whose work has ushered in a new era of popularity for the house. Fresh, floral perfume Top notes: green lilac and petitgrain Middle notes: peach blossom, wisteria, red peony, green tea, and Chinese osmanthus Base notes: amber, musk, and cedar Launched in 2010 1 or 1.7 fl. oz. spray bottle ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

The designer gained notoriety for hypersuggestive commercials for everything from blue jeans to perfume, launching the careers of models like Brooke Shields and Kate Moss in the process. But what has kept his brand relevant for over 40 years is its classic, impeccably tailored clothing.   writes, “Klein always understood that the modern shopper wanted easy, versatile, and interchangeable separates to wear anywhere.” He made clothes for strong, confident American women—women who didn’t have time to put together elaborate outfits every morning. “I’m not doing costumes,” he said. “I believe in classic clothes—not the faddishness that looks right this season and is dead the next.” Top notes: pineapple, green notes, mandarin orange, papaya, bergamot, cardamom, and lemon Heart notes: nutmeg, violet, orris root, jasmine, lily-of-the-valley, and rose Base notes: sandalwood, amber, musk, cedar, and oakmoss Launched in 1994 3.4 fl. oz. or 6.7 fl. oz. eau de toilette spray Spicy, oriental fragrance for men Top notes: citrusy clementine, fresh cucumber, and energy drink accord Heart notes: black pepper, black basil, and cardamom Base notes: tobacco, musk, patchouli, and ambrene wood  Launched in 2011 3.4 fl. oz. eau de toilette spray Floral, oriental fragrance for women Top notes: passion flower, pink peony, and poppy Heart notes: jasmine, narcissus, blackberry, and dark cocoa Base notes: amber, vanilla, musk, and patchouli Launched in 2011 6.7 fl. oz. eau de toilette spray ||Health & Beauty > Fragrance > Women's Fragrance

47648897||Burberry Body Eau de Parfum or Eau de Toilette for Women; 2 Oz. or 2.8 Oz. These light and fresh fragrances are ideal for everyday wear and feature notes of absinthe, peach, rose, sandalwood, and musk At his Hampshire shop in the 1850s, Thomas Burberry outfitted hunters and fishermen in rugged gear. Rain was a real misery for the outdoorsmen, so Burberry set out to create an alternative to an umbrella or the shade of an elephant. By 1888, he’d secured the patent for his design: a breathable cotton blend wound so tightly it could resist moisture and rips. Officially, it was called gabardine, but in common parlance, hunters, farmers, pub keepers, and even King Edward VII called it “Burberry.” At the onset of World War I, the inventor used the fabric for a waterproof trench coat literally for the trenches, fitted with the necessary epaulets and D-rings for an artillery-facing soldier. The trench’s style caught on and, decorated with Burberry’s signature tartan print, remains a staple of the brand today. Despite these ties to tradition, Burberry’s creative team lives by the motto  , Latin for “forward.” Classic time-tested shapes are updated with modern details such as statement buttons, metallic fabrics, and seasonal colors. Eau de toilette, 2oz. Eau de toilette, 2.8oz. Eau de parfum, 2oz. 45409190||CHI Limited Edition Rocket Low EMF Hair Dryer Low electromagnetic field hair dryer emits negative ions to dry up water molecules without damaging hair for a faster, healthier blow dry This powerful hair dryer blasts hot air and negative ions at wet hair to break up water molecules without stripping hair of moisture, so you get a quick, sleek blow dry with a glossy finish. Low EMF is a concern for some, especially women or stylists who use a blow dryer often, because EMF radiation in high doses has been linked to tumors and other health problems. 1,800-watt motor Cool shot button Two speed settings Nozzle included Best for thick, coarse hair No temperature settings Product dimensions: 12”x5”x12” Product weight: 2.5lb. ||Health & Beauty > Hair Care > Styling Tools
48302013||Paul Mitchell Smoothing Super Skinny Daily Treatment or Shampoo (1L.) Smoothing shampoo and daily treatment by Paul Mitchell help tame rebellious locks, leaving hair smooth, soft, and manageable In 1965, Paul Mitchell was a young hairdresser who was making waves in the salon industry—especially with his training. Said one-time boss Vidal Sassoon, “He had something terribly special. He could inspire people.” Mitchell went on to open the Paul Mitchell Cutting Club, where hairdressers around the country would flock to expand their skills with his wash-and-wear hairstyles and sculpting techniques. He later joined forces with entrepreneur John Paul DeJoria to create styling products under the Paul Mitchell brand, most notable of which was the Sculpting Foam. The duo also initiated green practices: they created a self-sustaining, solar-powered awapuhi farm in Hawaii, whose harvest continues to source the company’s Awapuhi Wild Ginger line of products today.  Mitchell’s legacy lives on today not only through nourishing hair serums and sculpting gels, but through the company’s commitment to caring. It was the first to come out against animal testing, and seeks to make the world a better place through charitable efforts. Would-be stylists can also learn their craft at Paul Mitchell Schools across the country. Cleanses and smoothes hair Leaves hair softer and more manageable  Cleanses hair without stripping its moisture Safe for color-treated hair 33.8 fl. oz. 45593975||Paul Mitchell Haircare Products Best of Paul Mitchell collection includes daily shampoos, conditioners, and products that target specific haircare or styling needs  In 1965, Paul Mitchell was a young hairdresser who was making waves in the salon industry—especially with his training. Said one-time boss Vidal Sassoon, “He had something terribly special. He could inspire people.” Mitchell went on to open the Paul Mitchell Cutting Club, where hairdressers around the country would flock to expand their skills with his wash-and-wear hairstyles and sculpting techniques. He later joined forces with entrepreneur John Paul DeJoria to create styling products under the Paul Mitchell brand, most notable of which was the Sculpting Foam. The duo also initiated green practices: they created a self-sustaining, solar-powered awapuhi farm in Hawaii, whose harvest continues to source the company’s Awapuhi Wild Ginger line of products today.  Mitchell’s legacy lives on today not only through nourishing hair serums and sculpting gels, but through the company’s commitment to caring. It was the first to come out against animal testing, and seeks to make the world a better place through charitable efforts. Would-be stylists can also learn their craft at Paul Mitchell Schools across the country. 44702918||InStyler Wet to Dry Rotating Hair Dryer and Styling Iron with Curved 1.25" Tourmaline Ceramic Floating Plate Straightener and curling iron dries your hair as you style it, saving you time and letting you skip the blow dryer The InStyler iron consolidates the drying and styling of your hair into a single process, cutting out the time-consuming step of using a blow dryer or riding a roller coaster from your morning routine. As you curl or straighten your hair, the iron draws water up its rotating barrel. The moisture then vents away quickly without damaging your hair. To start, use a towel to dry your hair as much as possible before you begin. Next, glide the iron slowly down your hair—once to dry, and once to style. Go slowly enough that you can hear a crackling sound, which indicates moisture is evaporating properly from your hair. The iron combines a rotating titanium barrel with a curved 1.25” tourmaline ceramic floating plate. Dries hair while straightening or curling Also adds volume and shine Multiple heat settings up to 410° Fahrenheit 30-second rapid heat-up Auto safety shut-off ||Health & Beauty > Hair Care > Styling Tools

46153251||Conair Simple Home Haircutting Kit (10-Piece) Easily trim and cut hair at home with this kit, which contains an electric clipper and attachments, barber scissors, and a comb Stainless steel blades Founded in a Queens garage in 1959, Conair, now hair-product supplier to the world, began by peddling hair rollers and dryers to local women wanting perfectly set curls at home. Matching the results of the hairdresser, the success of those products was the company’s first step toward expansion, and the momentum hasn’t slowed since. Conair’s hair dryers—now offered in seven subcategories—are joined by styling irons, personal grooming products, fabric steamers, and even sound-therapy machines. Yet despite the company’s broad product range, its commitment to quality hasn’t flagged. 42245983||Rusk Curl Freak Professional Curl Machine Automated curling device draws hair inside a ceramic chamber to create sleek, uniform curls and waves This machine is designed to create smooth, uniform curls without the strain and fuss of twisting a traditional curling iron.  Hair is drawn into a ceramic curl chamber, where it’s coiled and heated up until each curl is set. Users can choose to release the hair on their own or opt for a pre-set timer that beeps when it’s time to set hair free after creating a loose wave, soft curl, or more-defined curl. Start by lightly misting your hair with hairspray and making sure it’s combed through and tangle-free. Choose a one-inch section of hair and position the ends at the open mouth of the curl chamber. When you close the chamber, the machine will automatically draw your hair inside, and if you choose a timer setting, it will beep to let you know when the curl is ready. 45230218||X5 Superlite Tourmaline Ionic Hair Dryer Ionic hair dryer uses negative ions to heat your hair from the inside out, resulting in faster drying times and less damage to your hair Tourmaline hair dryer uses negative ions to dry your hair faster and more efficiently, causing less damage and leaving your hair healthy and smooth. Four solid ceramic stones are imbedded in the heating element of this hair dryer. As the dryer heats up, these stones generate large numbers of negatively charged nano ions that can penetrate the follicles of your hair, heating from the inside out and drying your hair in less time. The faster drying time means less heat damage to your hair, resulting in stronger, shinier, and healthier locks. Using the right technique to blow dry can minimize damage and leave you looking like you just stepped out of the salon. After adding any desired product to towel-dried hair, separate your locks into manageable sections and using a round brush, keep strands smooth as you dry from root to tip—a technique that adds volume and minimizes frizz. When you’re finished, a cool blast of air from the “cool” setting can set your hair in place for style that lasts all day. 47653404||Vidal Sassoon Pro Series Digital Tourmaline Ceramic Curling Iron Tourmaline ceramic technology reaches up to 400ºF to create smooth, shiny, bouncy, and frizz-free curls “It’s Vidal Sassoon.” Though that’s barely all poor Rosemary Woodhouse could utter to her shocked husband in an iconic scene from  , the line proved to speak volumes upon the film’s release. Despite its demonic associations, Rosemary’s strawberry blond pixie cut instantly helped set a trend. Late hairstylist Vidal Sassoon based the pixie and other cuts on the belief that hair should be modern and low maintenance; his wedge bob and geometric perm, equally popular in their day, also attest to this ease of manageability. Today Sassoon’s name lives on through his extensive line of haircare products. Known for their color-protecting formulas and reparative properties, his shampoos, conditioners, and dyes keep hair glossy, beautiful, and, yes, low maintenance. While working as a professional hairdresser for 20+ years, Arnie Miller learned the ins and outs of the salon industry—especially what it took to grow a business and nourish talent. That’s why when he and his wife, Sydell, tried their hands at creating hair-care products, they built a comprehensive line that would help hairdressers produce their best work. Now known as Matrix, the company’s offerings range from permanent and semi-permanent colors to Biolage moisturizing and volumizing shampoos. Matrix upholds the Millers’ original commitment to salons with artistic directors who travel around the world to demonstrate new styles and cutting-edge techniques. The company also helps regular hairstylists serve as ambassadors to their own communities through the Chairs for Change organization, which helps empower them to make positive changes in their surroundings. 44948719||R-Beauty 1.5" Ceramic Classic Straightener, 0.5" Ceramic Mini Straightener, and Tapered Ceramic Curling Iron Bundle This set includes multi-functional hair styling accessories perfect for a young woman just stepping into the scene or for a mature stylist Armed with this set of hair tools, you can style hair of any length into sleek, pin-straight locks or long-lasting curls. The Mini and Classic straightener utilize far-infrared heat to preserve hair’s natural moisture and protect cuticles from damage. The tourmaline-infused ceramic barrel of the clipless curling iron produces negative ions, which work to seal the cuticle and produce frizz-free waves and curls. Unlike with a traditional curling iron, a tapered-barrel curling iron requires you to wrap the roots of your hair (rather than the ends) around the iron first. Starting at the highest portion of hair you want to curl, wrap hair around the base of the iron and continue wrapping up to the tip. The closer to the tip of the iron you get, the tighter the curls will be. To make styling more manageable, first divide hair into manageable sections, clipping each to the top of the head. Allow a single layer to hang down. Once device is warmed to desired heat level, separate a small strip of hair from the hanging section. Clamp the iron to this strip near the roots, and gently pull down towards the tips. Repeat this process till all sections are straight. Heat levels may vary per hair type; delicate hair may be better treated with repeated quick passes with low heat, while thicker more curly hair can be managed with single strokes on a high heat setting. Mini-straightener can be especially useful for last minute styling or travel. R-Beauty Classic straightener with 1.5” ceramic plates R-Beauty Grande curling iron with a 18mm–25mm tapered, clipless barrel R-Beauty Mini straightener with 0.5” ceramic plates Set of three ceramic hair tools Includes clips to help section off hair when styling ||Health & Beauty > Hair Care > Styling Tools

Their modern product line includes eco-friendly formulas crafted from botanical extracts and conditioning silicone styling products. 45409307||Schwarzkopf Moisture Kick Recharger Conditioning Foam (5.1 Fl. Oz.) The Schwarzkopf Moisture Kick Recharger conditioning foam can make curly hair stretchier and softer by bolstering its internal structure The Schwarzkopf haircare line began 111 years ago, when chemist Hans Schwarzkopf tinkered with formulas in the back of his Berlin drugstore. His experiments led to the development of innovative products, including the first liquid shampoo, aerosol hairspray, cold perm, and powdered wigs. With these innovations, the brand’s popularity grew. Today, Schwarzkopf continues to brew cleaning, coloring, and styling products that are found in the toolkits of stylists around the globe. 44723008||Revlon 1" Ceramic Tourmaline Curling Iron Style hair into bouncy curls or sultry waves with this curling iron, which has a tourmaline-infused ceramic barrel to keep curls smooth Revlon makes a business of staying ahead of the fashion curve. When it debuted in department stores in 1932, Revlon was the first cosmetics company to offer nail enamel in a color other than red. And later, during the 1950s when American women were looking to foreign Hollywood stars for beauty inspiration, Revlon used American-born models in its print ads to help build up US women’s self-images. Throughout the next few decades, Revlon matched the strides women were taking, adding new and interesting products that mirrored women’s growing roles in business and politics. Now, Revlon’s cosmetics line has extended to include Age Defying foundations and Ultra HD lipstick represented through the years by ambassadors from Cindy Crawford to Emma Stone. 45437721||Temporary Neon Hair Color Chalk Kit (6-Piece) With six bold colors, hair chalk can give you bright temporary hair color that is less damaging than traditional hair dyes Add a little color to your hair with easy-to-use hair chalk, which can give you bold and colorful hair for up to three days. Start off with clean, product-free hair. Choose the sections that you want colored and rub the hair between the chalk and your finger, being sure that the hair is coated evenly on all sides. After the hair is coated, a straightener or curling iron can be used to seal in the color. When you’re done, shake out your hair to remove any excess chalk powder, and your hair color is ready to go. Other hair dyes may contain harsh chemicals that damage your hair, so hair chalk is a safer alternative that can still give you those bold, fun colors. As an added bonus, the temporary color washes out in about three days, allowing you to experiment and change your hair as many times as you want without extra breakage.
